Package moneyservice.hq.app

Class HQApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • moneyservice.hq.app.HQApp
  • public class HQApp
extends java.lang.Object
    This class works as HeadQuarter for Site(s). It collects all the statistics from the Site(s) and present it to the user depending on input

      • getTransactions

        private static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<Transaction>> getTransactions()
        This method collects all the Transactions for each Site and put it in a Map
        Returns:
        Map<String, List<Transaction>> holding Site as Key and a List with all Transactions for each Site

        This method gets all files in a specific path
        Parameters:
        aSite - a String holding a specific Site
        path - a String with a Path to current folder
        extension - a String defining file format
        Returns:
        List<String> with all the file names in the path for specific Site

      • getInputUint

        private static int getInputUint()
        Gets unsigned number from user input. If entry is not valid return value equals to -1
        Returns:
        num an int >= 0 OR -1 if input is invalid

        private static java.util.Optional<java.time.LocalDate> setEndDate​(Period period,
                                                                  java.util.Optional<java.time.LocalDate> startDate)
        This method is used to set the end date depending on which period that is entered
        Parameters:
        period - a Period (enum) holding a Period from user input
        startDate - a LocalDate holding information about the start date of the period
        Returns:
        an Optional<LocalDate> with the end date for period

      • setStartDate

        This method is used to set the start date depending on which period that is entered
        Parameters:
        period - a Period (enum) holding a Period from user input
        startDate - a LocalDate holding information about the start date of the period
        Returns:
        an Optional<LocalDate> with the new start date for period

      • presentCurrencyMenu

        private static java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> presentCurrencyMenu​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> currencyCodes)
        This method presents the available currencies and gets input for currency from user
        Parameters:
        currencyCodes - a List<String> with all the available currency codes
        Returns:
        a String from user input holding a specific currency or ALL for all currencies
